Headline: #74 Fullerton Temporary Reroute at Fullerton/Monticello
ShortDescription: 74 Fullerton buses are temporarily rerouted via Fullerton, Pulaski, Armitage, Central Park & Fullerton, due to street blockage near Fullerton/Monticello.

FullDescription.#cdata-section:
#74 Fullerton buses are temporarily rerouted in both directions via Fullerton, Pulaski, Armitage, Central Park, then resume their normal route at Fullerton, due to street blockage near Fullerton/Monticello.

Allow extra travel time.

Headline: Green Line on Loop 'L' rerouted via Wells, Van Buren
ShortDescription: Harlem-bound Green Line service has been rerouted via the Wells and Van Buren sides of Loop due to signal problems affecting service near Clark/Lake.

FullDescription.#cdata-section:
Harlem-bound Green Line service has been rerouted via the Wells and Van Buren sides of Loop due to signal problems affecting service near Clark/Lake.
 
On the Loop 'L', Harlem-bound Green Line trains will serve H.W. Library-State/Van Buren, LaSalle/Van Buren, Quincy and Washington/Wells stations instead of their usual stops.
 

For Harlem-bound Green Line service: 

Board Harlem-bound Green Line trains on what is normally the Orange Line side at these stations.

63rd-bound Green Line Service is unaffected.
 
See station personnel for further assistance, and pay attention to announcements on trains and at stations for service information.
 
We appreciate your patience as we work to restore normal service. Allow extra travel time.

Headline: Brown Line Delays
ShortDescription: Brown Line trains are running w/residual delays and congestion following earlier signal problems near Clark/Lake. Service is resuming, allow extra time.

FullDescription.#cdata-section:
Brown Line trains are running with residual delays and congestion following earlier signal problems near Clark/Lake.

Some trains and platforms may be busier than usual as crews work to restore normal service.

Trains are moving and normal service is being restored.

Allow extra travel time.

Headline: Service Between 54th/Cermak and Polk, then Racine (Blue Line) Stations, Only
ShortDescription: Pink Line trains operate from 54th to Polk only, then connect w/Blue Line at Racine for continuing service, due to signal problems near Clark/Lake.

FullDescription.#cdata-section:
Pink Line service has been temporarily suspended between Polk and the Loop due signal problems.

As a result, Pink Line trains are running as follows:

  • Between 54th/Cermak and Polk, and then are diverted to Racine on the Blue Line for direct connections at Racine to continuing Blue Line train service to/from downtown.

Using connecting Blue Line service:

  • For service to downtown from Pink Line stations between 54th/Cermak and Polk, take a Pink Line train toward the Loop and stay on board until the train reaches Racine on the Blue Line. Transfer to an O'Hare-bound Blue Line train from the same platform for service into downtown.

  • For service from downtown to Pink Line stations between Polk and 54th/Cermak, take a Blue Line train toward Forest Park to Racine. Stay on the same platform side and wait for a 54th/Cermak-bound Pink Line train.

Other possible alternatives may include:

  • #9 Ashland
  • #21 Cermak
  • #49 Western
  • #50 Damen
  • #52 Kedzie/California
  • #53 Pulaski
  • #54 Cicero
  • #60 Blue Island-26th
  • #82 Kimball-Homan

See station personnel for further assistance, and pay attention to announcements on trains and at stations for service information.

We are working to restore service as quickly as possible. Allow extra travel time.
